name: df-marrep
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7
body: |- wceq(cmarrep, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cmpo(s2, s3, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s0), cmat, cv(s1))), cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), cmpo(s4, s5, cv(s0), cv(s0), cmpo(s6, s7, cv(s0), cv(s0), cif(cif(cv(s3), cfv(c0g, cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s7), cv(s5))), co(cv(s6), cv(s2), cv(s7)), wceq(cv(s6), cv(s4))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ matRRep =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà(Base `(s0[Mat]s1)), s3 ‚àà(Base ` s1)‚Ü¶(s4 ‚àà s0, s5 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶(s6 ‚àà s0, s7 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶ if(s6 = s4, if(s7 = s5, s3,(0 ` s1)),(s6[s2]s7))))))
comment: Define the matrices whose k-th row is replaced by 0's and an arbitrary element of the underlying ring at the l-th column. (Contributed by AV, 12-Feb-2019.)
